c.description: Whether to retain or strip comments in statements sent to the server

C.description: Compress all information sent between client and server

T.description: Print debugging information, memory, and CPU statistics when program exits

f.description: Continue even if an SQL error occurs

h.description: Host on which MySQL server is located

b.description: Do not beep when errors occur

o.description: Ignore statements except those for the default database named on the command line

p.description: Password to use when connecting to server

W.description: Connect to server using named pipe (Windows only)

q.description: Do not cache each query result

r.description: Write column values without escape conversion

U.description: Allow only UPDATE and DELETE statements that specify key values

N.description: Do not write column names in results

S.description: Unix socket file or Windows named pipe to use

n.description: Flush the buffer after each query

u.description: MySQL user name to use when connecting to server

E.description: Print query output rows vertically (one line per column value)

w.description: If the connection cannot be established, wait and retry instead of aborting

auto-vertical-output.description: Enable automatic vertical result set display

binary-as-hex.description: Display binary values in hexadecimal notation

binary-mode.description: Disable \r\n - to - \n translation and treatment of \0 as end-of-query

bind-address.description: Use specified network interface to connect to MySQL Server

character-sets-dir.description: Directory where character sets are installed

comments.description: Whether to retain or strip comments in statements sent to the server

compress.description: Compress all information sent between client and server

compression-algorithms.description: Permitted compression algorithms for connections to server

connect-expired-password.description: Indicate to server that client can handle expired-password sandbox mode

connect-timeout.description: Number of seconds before connection timeout

debug.description: Write debugging log; supported only if MySQL was built with debugging support

debug-check.description: Print debugging information when program exits

debug-info.description: Print debugging information, memory, and CPU statistics when program exits

defaults-extra-file.description: Read named option file in addition to usual option files

dns-srv-name.description: Use DNS SRV lookup for host information

force.description: Continue even if an SQL error occurs

get-server-public-key.description: Request RSA public key from server

histignore.description: Patterns specifying which statements to ignore for logging

host.description: Host on which MySQL server is located

init-command.description: SQL statement to execute after connecting

load-data-local-dir.description: Directory for files named in LOAD DATA LOCAL statements

local-infile.description: Enable or disable for LOCAL capability for LOAD DATA

max-allowed-packet.description: Maximum packet length to send to or receive from server

max-join-size.description: The automatic limit for rows in a join when using --safe-updates

net-buffer-length.description: Buffer size for TCP/IP and socket communication

no-beep.description: Do not beep when errors occur

one-database.description: Ignore statements except those for the default database named on the command line

pager.description: Use the given command for paging query output

password.description: Password to use when connecting to server

pipe.description: Connect to server using named pipe (Windows only)

prompt.description: Set the prompt to the specified format

quick.description: Do not cache each query result

raw.description: Write column values without escape conversion

reconnect.description: If the connection to the server is lost, automatically try to reconnect

safe-updates.description: Allow only UPDATE and DELETE statements that specify key values

i-am-a-dummy.description: Allow only UPDATE and DELETE statements that specify key values

select-limit.description: The automatic limit for SELECT statements when using --safe-updates

server-public-key-path.description: Path name to file containing RSA public key

shared-memory-base-name.description: Shared-memory name for shared-memory connections (Windows only)

show-warnings.description: Show warnings after each statement if there are any

sigint-ignore.description: Ignore SIGINT signals (typically the result of typing Control+C)

skip-column-names.description: Do not write column names in results

socket.description: Unix socket file or Windows named pipe to use

ssl-ca.description: File that contains list of trusted SSL Certificate Authorities

ssl-capath.description: Directory that contains trusted SSL Certificate Authority certificate files

ssl-crl.description: File that contains certificate revocation lists

ssl-crlpath.description: Directory that contains certificate revocation-list files

ssl-fips-mode.description: Whether to enable FIPS mode on client side

ssl-mode.description: Desired security state of connection to server

tee.description: Append a copy of output to named file

tls-ciphersuites.description: Permissible TLSv1.3 ciphersuites for encrypted connections

tls-version.description: Permissible TLS protocols for encrypted connections

unbuffered.description: Flush the buffer after each query

user.description: MySQL user name to use when connecting to server

vertical.description: Print query output rows vertically (one line per column value)

wait.description: If the connection cannot be established, wait and retry instead of aborting

zstd-compression-level.description: Compression level for connections to server that use zstd compression
